summary: This document is the FY-2019 Annual Training schedule for staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It outlines an 8-week training program from March to May 2019, covering topics such as ethics, inmate supervision, use of force, and the prevention of sexually abusive behavior (PREA). The document is significant as it details the standard operating procedures and training environment at the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died in 2019.

keyFacts: The Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York conducted its FY-2019 Annual Training from March 4 to May 3, 2019.
Training included a mandatory module on the 'Sexually Abusive Behavior Prevention & Intervention Program (PREA)' (CPG-0230-BXX).
The training schedule was held at 26 Federal Plaza, 6th Floor, Classroom J or I, which is the location of the MCC New York.
Firearms training for staff was conducted at FCI Danbury.
The document provides insight into the standard training curriculum for federal correctional officers in 2019, including topics on inmate management, ethics, and emergency procedures.
